Richmond.Memorial to the Women of the Confederacy: The Memorial to the Women of the Confederacy, also known as the U.D.C. Memorial Building, is a historic building located in Richmond, Virginia, that serves as the national headquarters of the U.D.C. It was listed on the U.S. National Register of Historic Places in 2008. The building is open to the public on scheduled days as advertised on the U.D.C. Home Page. The Caroline Meriwether Goodlett Library and the Helen Walpole Brewer Records Room are open by appointment only.
